   22: -module(ssh_connection_SUITE).

   28: 
   29: -export([
   30:          suite/0,
   31:          all/0,
   32:          groups/0,
   33:          init_per_suite/1,
   34:          end_per_suite/1,
   35:          init_per_group/2,
   36:          end_per_group/2,
   37:          init_per_testcase/2,
   38:          end_per_testcase/2
   39:         ]).
   40: 
   41: -export([
   42:          big_cat/1,
   43:          connect_sock_not_passive/1,
   44:          connect_sock_not_tcp/1,

   51:          connect3_invalid_options/1,
   52:          connect3_invalid_timeout_0/1,

   55:          connect4_invalid_two_0/1,
   56:          connect4_invalid_two_1/1,

   58:          connect4_invalid_three/1,

   70:          gracefull_invalid_long_start_no_nl/1,

   72:          gracefull_invalid_version/1,
   73:          kex_error/1,
   74:          interrupted_send/1,
   75:          max_channels_option/1,
   76:          no_sensitive_leak/1,
   77:          ptty_alloc/1,
   78:          ptty_alloc_default/1,
   79:          ptty_alloc_pixel/1,
   80:          read_write_loop/1,
   81:          read_write_loop1/2,
   82:          send_after_exit/1,
   83:          simple_eval/1,
   84:          simple_exec/1,
   85:          simple_exec_more_data/1,
   86:          simple_exec_sock/1,
   87:          simple_exec_two_socks/1,
   88:          small_cat/1,
   89:          small_interrupted_send/1,
   90:          start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write/1,
   91:          start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced/1,
   92:          start_shell/1,
   93:          new_shell_dumb_term/1,
   94:          new_shell_xterm_term/1,
   95:          start_shell_pty/1,
   96:          start_shell_exec/1,
   97:          start_shell_exec_direct_fun/1,
   98:          start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error/1,
   99:          start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type/1,
  100:          start_shell_exec_direct_fun2/1,
  101:          start_shell_exec_direct_fun3/1,
  102:          start_shell_exec_direct_fun_more_data/1,
  103:          start_shell_exec_fun/1,
  104:          start_shell_exec_fun2/1,
  105:          start_shell_exec_fun3/1,
  106:          start_shell_sock_daemon_exec/1,
  107:          start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi/1,
  108:          start_shell_sock_exec_fun/1,
  109:          start_subsystem_on_closed_channel/1,
  110:          stop_listener/1,
  111:          ssh_exec_echo/2 % called as an MFA
  112:         ]).
  113: 
  114: -define(EXEC_TIMEOUT, 10000).
  115: 
  116: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  117: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
  118: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  119: 
  120: %% suite() ->
  121: %%     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
  122: 
  123: suite() ->
  124:     [{timetrap,{seconds,40}}].
  125: 
  126: all() ->
  127:     [
  128:      {group, openssh},
  129:      small_interrupted_send,
  130:      interrupted_send,
  131:      exec_erlang_term,
  132:      exec_erlang_term_non_default_shell,
  133:      exec_disabled,
  134:      exec_shell_disabled,
  135:      start_shell,
  136:      new_shell_dumb_term,
  137:      new_shell_xterm_term,
  138:      start_shell_pty,
  139:      start_shell_exec,
  140:      start_shell_exec_fun,
  141:      start_shell_exec_fun2,
  142:      start_shell_exec_fun3,
  143:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun,
  144:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun2,
  145:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun3,
  146:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun_more_data,
  147:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error,
  148:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type,
  149:      start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write,
  150:      start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced,
  151:      start_shell_sock_exec_fun,
  152:      start_shell_sock_daemon_exec,
  153:      start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi,
  154:      encode_decode_pty_opts,
  155:      connect_sock_not_tcp,
  156:      connect2_invalid_options,
  157:      connect_invalid_port,
  158:      connect_invalid_options,
  159:      connect_invalid_timeout_0,
  160:      connect_invalid_timeout_1,
  161:      connect3_invalid_port,
  162:      connect3_invalid_options,
  163:      connect3_invalid_timeout_0,
  164:      connect3_invalid_timeout_1,
  165:      connect3_invalid_both,
  166:      connect4_invalid_two_0,
  167:      connect4_invalid_two_1,
  168:      connect4_invalid_two_2,
  169:      connect4_invalid_three,
  170:      connect_timeout,
  171:      daemon_sock_not_tcp,
  172:      gracefull_invalid_version,
  173:      gracefull_invalid_start,
  174:      gracefull_invalid_long_start,
  175:      gracefull_invalid_long_start_no_nl,
  176:      kex_error,
  177:      stop_listener,
  178:      no_sensitive_leak,
  179:      start_subsystem_on_closed_channel,
  180:      max_channels_option
  181:     ].
  182: groups() ->
  183:     [{openssh, [], payload() ++ ptty() ++ sock()}].
  184: 
  185: payload() ->
  186:     [simple_exec,
  187:      simple_exec_more_data,
  188:      simple_exec_sock,
  189:      simple_exec_two_socks,
  190:      small_cat,
  191:      big_cat,
  192:      send_after_exit].
  193: 
  194: ptty() ->
  195:     [ptty_alloc_default,
  196:      ptty_alloc,
  197:      ptty_alloc_pixel].
  198: 
  199: sock() ->
  200:     [connect_sock_not_passive,
  201:      daemon_sock_not_passive
  202:     ].
  203: 
  204: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  205: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  206:     ?CHECK_CRYPTO(
  207:        [{ptty_supported, ssh_test_lib:ptty_supported()}
  208:         | Config]
  209:       ).
  210: 
  211: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  212:     catch ssh:stop(),
  213:     ok.
  214: 
  215: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  216: init_per_group(openssh, Config) ->
  217:     case ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []) of
  218: 	{error,econnrefused} ->
  219: 	    {skip,"No openssh daemon (econnrefused)"};
  220: 	{ok, Socket} ->
  221: 	    gen_tcp:close(Socket),
  222: 	    ssh_test_lib:openssh_sanity_check(Config)
  223:     end;
  224: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
  225:     Config.
  226: 
  227: end_per_group(_, Config) ->
  228:     Config.
  229: 
  230: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  231: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  232:     %% To make sure we start clean as it is not certain that
  233:     %% end_per_testcase will be run!
  234:     end_per_testcase(any, Config),
  235:     ssh:start(),
  236:     ssh_test_lib:verify_sanity_check(Config).
  237: 
  238: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, _Config) ->
  239:     ssh:stop().
  240: 
  241: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  242: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  243: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  244: simple_exec(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  245:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  246:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef).
  247: 
  248: simple_exec_more_data(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  249:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  250:     %% more data received, SSH window adjust needs to be sent by client
  251:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, 60000).
  252: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  253: simple_exec_sock(_Config) ->
  254:     {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{active,false}]),
  255:     {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  256:                                              {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  257:                                              {user_interaction, true}
  258:                                             ]),
  259:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef).
  260: 
  261: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  262: simple_exec_two_socks(_Config) ->
  263:     Parent = self(),
  264:     F = fun() ->
  265:                 spawn_link(
  266:                   fun() ->
  267:                           {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{active,false}]),
  268:                           {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  269:                                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  270:                                                                    {user_interaction, true}]),
  271:                           Parent ! {self(),do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef)}
  272:                   end)
  273:         end,
  274:     Pid1 = F(),
  275:     Pid2 = F(),
  276:     receive
  277:         {Pid1,ok} -> ok
  278:     end,
  279:     receive
  280:         {Pid2,ok} -> ok
  281:     end.
  282: 
  283: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  284: connect2_invalid_options(_Config) ->
  285:     {error, invalid_options} = ssh:connect(bogus_socket, {bad, option}).
  286: 
  287: connect3_invalid_port(_Config) ->
  288:     {error, invalid_port} = ssh:connect(bogus_host, noport, [{key, value}]).
  289: 
  290: connect3_invalid_options(_Config) ->
  291:     {error, invalid_options} = ssh:connect(bogus_host, 1337, bad_options).
  292: 
  293: connect3_invalid_timeout_0(_Config) ->
  294:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  295:         ssh:connect(bogus_socket, [{key, value}], short).
  296: 
  297: connect3_invalid_timeout_1(_Config) ->
  298:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  299:         ssh:connect(bogus_socket, [{key, value}], -1).
  300: 
  301: connect3_invalid_both(_Config) ->
  302:     %% The actual reason is implementation dependent.
  303:     {error, _Reason} =
  304:         ssh:connect(bogus, no_list_or_port, no_list_or_timeout).
  305: 
  306: connect_invalid_port(Config) ->
  307:     {Pid, Host, _Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  308: 
  309:     {error, invalid_port} =
  310:         ssh:connect(Host, undefined,
  311:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  312:                      {user, "foo"},
  313:                      {password, "morot"},
  314:                      {user_interaction, false},
  315:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  316:                     infinity),
  317: 
  318:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  319: 
  320: connect_invalid_timeout_0(Config) ->
  321:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  322: 
  323:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  324:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  325:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  326:                      {user, "foo"},
  327:                      {password, "morot"},
  328:                      {user_interaction, false},
  329:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  330:                    longer),
  331: 
  332:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  333: 
  334: connect_invalid_timeout_1(Config) ->
  335:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  336: 
  337:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  338:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  339:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  340:                      {user, "foo"},
  341:                      {password, "morot"},
  342:                      {user_interaction, false},
  343:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  344:                    -1),
  345: 
  346:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  347: 
  348: connect_invalid_options(Config) ->
  349:     {Pid, Host, Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  350: 
  351:     {error, invalid_options} =
  352:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  353:                     {user, "foo"},
  354:                     infinity),
  355: 
  356:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  357: 
  358: %% Two out three arguments incorrect.  Three possibilities.
  359: connect4_invalid_two_0(Config) ->
  360:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  361: 
  362:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  363:     {error, _} =
  364:         ssh:connect(Host, noport,
  365:                     {user, "foo"},
  366:                     infinity),
  367: 
  368:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  369: 
  370: connect4_invalid_two_1(Config) ->
  371:     {Pid, Host, Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  372: 
  373:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  374:     {error, _} =
  375:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  376:                     {user, "foo"},
  377:                     short),
  378: 
  379:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  380: 
  381: connect4_invalid_two_2(Config) ->
  382:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  383: 
  384:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  385:     {error, _} =
  386:         ssh:connect(Host, newport,
  387:                     [{user, "foo"}],
  388:                     -1),
  389: 
  390:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  391: 
  392: %% All three args incorrect
  393: connect4_invalid_three(Config) ->
  394:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  395: 
  396:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  397:     {error, _} =
  398:         ssh:connect(Host, teleport,
  399:                     {user, "foo"},
  400:                     fortnight),
  401: 
  402:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  403: 
  404: daemon_start(Config) ->
  405:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  406:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  407:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  408:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  409: 
  410:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  411:                                              {user_dir, UserDir},
  412:                                              {password, "morot"},
  413:                                              {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
  414:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir}.
  415: 
  416: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  417: connect_sock_not_tcp(_Config) ->
  418:     {ok,Sock} = gen_udp:open(0, []), 
  419:     {error, not_tcp_socket} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  420:                                                  {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  421:                                                  {user_interaction, true}]),
  422:     gen_udp:close(Sock).
  423: 
  424: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  425: connect_timeout(_Config) ->
  426:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, []),
  427:     {ok, {_,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),
  428:     {error,timeout} = ssh:connect(loopback, Port, [{connect_timeout,2000},
  429:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
  430:                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true}]),
  431:     gen_tcp:close(Sl).
  432: 
  433: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  434: daemon_sock_not_tcp(_Config) ->
  435:     {ok,Sock} = gen_udp:open(0, []), 
  436:     {error, not_tcp_socket} = ssh:daemon(Sock),
  437:     gen_udp:close(Sock).
  438: 
  439: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  440: connect_sock_not_passive(_Config) ->
  441:     {ok,Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []), 
  442:     {error, not_passive_mode} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  443:                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  444:                                                    {user_interaction, true}]),
  445:     gen_tcp:close(Sock).
  446: 
  447: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  448: daemon_sock_not_passive(_Config) ->
  449:     {ok,Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []), 
  450:     {error, not_passive_mode} = ssh:daemon(Sock),
  451:     gen_tcp:close(Sock).
  452: 
  453: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  454: small_cat(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  455:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  456:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  457:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  458: 				  "cat", infinity),
  459: 
  460:     Data = <<"I like spaghetti squash">>,
  461:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data),
  462:     ok = ssh_connection:send_eof(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0),
  463: 
  464:     %% receive response to input
  465:     receive
  466: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, Data}} ->
  467: 	    ok
  468:     after 
  469: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  470:     end,
  471: 
  472:     %% receive close messages
  473:     receive
  474: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
  475: 	    ok
  476:     after 
  477: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  478:     end,
  479:     receive
  480: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
  481: 	    ok
  482:     after 
  483: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  484:     end,
  485:     receive
  486: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  487: 	    ok
  488:     after 
  489: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  490:     end.
  491: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  492: big_cat(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  493:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  494: 							     {user_interaction, false}]),
  495:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  496:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  497: 				  "cat", infinity),
  498: 
  499:     %% build 10MB binary
  500:     Data = << <<X:32>> || X <- lists:seq(1,2500000)>>,
  501: 
  502:     ct:log("sending ~p byte binary~n",[size(Data)]),
  503:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data, 10000),
  504:     ok = ssh_connection:send_eof(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0),
  505: 
  506:     %% collect echoed data until eof
  507:     case big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0) of
  508: 	{ok, Data} ->
  509: 	    ok;
  510: 	{ok, Other} ->
  511: 	    case size(Data) =:= size(Other) of
  512: 		true ->
  513: 		    ct:log("received and sent data are same"
  514: 			   "size but do not match~n",[]);
  515: 		false ->
  516: 		    ct:log("sent ~p but only received ~p~n",
  517: 			   [size(Data), size(Other)])
  518: 	    end,
  519: 	    ct:fail(receive_data_mismatch);
  520: 	Else ->
  521: 	    ct:fail(Else)
  522:     end,
  523: 
  524:     %% receive close messages (eof already consumed)
  525:     receive
  526: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
  527: 	    ok 
  528:     after 
  529: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  530:     end,
  531:     receive
  532: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  533: 	    ok
  534:     after 
  535: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  536:     end.
  537: 
  538: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  539: send_after_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  540:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  541:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  542:     Data = <<"I like spaghetti squash">>,
  543: 
  544:     %% Shell command "false" will exit immediately
  545:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  546: 				  "false", infinity),
  547:     receive
  548: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
  549: 	    ok
  550:     after 
  551: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  552:     end,
  553:     receive
  554: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, ExitStatus}} when ExitStatus=/=0 ->
  555: 	    ok
  556:     after 
  557: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  558:     end,
  559:     receive
  560: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  561: 	    ok
  562:     after 
  563: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  564:     end,
  565:     case ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data, 2000) of
  566: 	{error, closed} -> ok;
  567: 	ok ->
  568: 	    ct:fail({expected,{error,closed}, {got, ok}});
  569: 	{error, timeout} ->
  570: 	    ct:fail({expected,{error,closed}, {got, {error, timeout}}});
  571: 	Else ->
  572: 	    ct:fail(Else)
  573:     end.
  574: 
  575: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  576: encode_decode_pty_opts(_Config) ->
  577:     Tags =
  578:         [vintr, vquit, verase, vkill, veof, veol, veol2, vstart, vstop, vsusp, vdsusp,
  579:          vreprint, vwerase, vlnext, vflush, vswtch, vstatus, vdiscard, ignpar, parmrk,
  580:          inpck, istrip, inlcr, igncr, icrnl, iuclc, ixon, ixany, ixoff, imaxbel, isig,
  581:          icanon, xcase, echo, echoe, echok, echonl, noflsh, tostop, iexten, echoctl,
  582:          echoke, pendin, opost, olcuc, onlcr, ocrnl, onocr, onlret, cs7, cs8, parenb,
  583:          parodd, tty_op_ispeed, tty_op_ospeed],
  584:     Opts =
  585:         lists:zip(Tags,
  586:                   lists:seq(1, length(Tags))),
  587:     
  588:     case ssh_connection:encode_pty_opts(Opts) of
  589:         Bin when is_binary(Bin) ->
  590:             case ssh_connection:decode_pty_opts(Bin) of
  591:                 Opts ->
  592:                     ok;
  593:                 Other ->
  594:                     ct:log("Expected ~p~nGot ~p~nBin = ~p",[Opts,Other,Bin]),
  595:                     ct:fail("Not the same",[])
  596:             end;
  597:         Other ->
  598:             ct:log("encode -> ~p",[Other]),
  599:             ct:fail("Encode failed",[])
  600:     end.
  601: 
  602: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  603: ptty_alloc_default(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  604:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  605:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  606:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  607:                  true -> success;
  608:                  false -> failure
  609:              end,
  610:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, []),
  611:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  612: 
  613: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  614: ptty_alloc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  615:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  616:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  617:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  618:                  true -> success;
  619:                  false -> failure
  620:              end,
  621:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, 
  622:                                        [{term, os:getenv("TERM", ?DEFAULT_TERMINAL)}, {width, 70}, {height, 20}]),
  623:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  624: 
  625: 
  626: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  627: ptty_alloc_pixel(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  628:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  629:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  630:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  631:                  true -> success;
  632:                  false -> failure
  633:              end,
  634:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, 
  635:                                        [{term, os:getenv("TERM", ?DEFAULT_TERMINAL)}, {pixel_widh, 630}, {pixel_hight, 470}]),
  636:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  637: 
  638: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  639: small_interrupted_send(Config) ->
  640:     K = 1024,
  641:     SendSize = 10 * K * K,
  642:     EchoSize = 4 * K,
  643:     do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize, {error, closed}).
  644: interrupted_send(Config) ->
  645:     K = 1024,
  646:     SendSize = 10 * K * K,
  647:     EchoSize = 4 * K * K,
  648:     do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize, ok).
  649: 
  650: do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize, SenderResult) ->
  651:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  652:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  653:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  654:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  655:     EchoSS_spec = {ssh_echo_server, [EchoSize,[{dbg,true}]]},
  656:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  657: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  658: 					     {password, "morot"},
  659: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n",EchoSS_spec}]}]),
  660:     ct:log("~p:~p connect", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  661:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  662: 						      {user, "foo"},
  663: 						      {password, "morot"},
  664: 						      {user_interaction, false},
  665: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  666:     ct:log("~p:~p connected", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  667:     %% build big binary
  668:     Data = << <<X:32>> || X <- lists:seq(1,SendSize div 4)>>,
  669:     %% expect remote end to send us EchoSize back
  670:     <<ExpectedData:EchoSize/binary, _/binary>> = Data,
  671:     %% Spawn listener. Otherwise we could get a deadlock due to filled buffers
  672:     Parent = self(),
  673:     ResultPid = spawn(
  674: 		  fun() ->
  675: 			  ct:log("~p:~p open channel",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  676: 			  {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  677: 			  ct:log("~p:~p start subsystem", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  678: 			  case ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "echo_n", infinity) of
  679: 			      success ->
  680: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, ChannelId},
  681: 				  Result =
  682: 				      try collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize)
  683: 				      of
  684: 					  ExpectedData ->
  685: 					      ct:log("~p:~p got expected data",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  686: 					      ok;
  687: 					  Other ->
  688: 					      ct:log("~p:~p unexpected: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
  689: 					      {fail,"unexpected result in listener"}
  690: 				      catch
  691: 					  Class:Exception ->
  692: 					      {fail, io_lib:format("Listener exception ~p:~p",[Class,Exception])}
  693: 				      end,
  694: 				  Parent ! {self(), result, Result};
  695: 			      Other ->
  696: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, error, Other}
  697: 			  end
  698: 		  end),
  699:     receive
  700: 	{ResultPid, channelId, error, Other} ->
  701: 	    ct:log("~p:~p channelId error ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
  702: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  703: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  704: 	    {fail, "ssh_connection:subsystem"};
  705: 	{ResultPid, channelId, ChannelId} ->
  706: 	    ct:log("~p:~p ~p going to send ~p bytes", [?MODULE,?LINE,self(),size(Data)]),
  707: 	    SenderPid = spawn(fun() ->
  708: 				      Parent ! {self(),  ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Data, 30000)}
  709: 			      end),
  710: 	    receive
  711: 	    	{ResultPid, result, {fail, Fail}} ->
  712: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Listener failed: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Fail]),
  713: 		    {fail, Fail};
  714: 		{ResultPid, result, Result} ->
  715: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Got result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
  716: 		    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  717: 		    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  718: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Check sender", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  719: 		    receive
  720: 			{SenderPid, SenderResult} ->
  721: 			    ct:log("~p:~p ~p - That's what we expect :)",
  722:                                    [?MODULE,?LINE, SenderResult]),
  723: 			    ok;
  724: 			Msg ->
  725: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Not expected send result: ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  726: 			    {fail, "Not expected msg"}
  727: 		    end;
  728: 		{SenderPid, SenderResult} ->
  729: 		    ct:log("~p:~p ~p - That's what we expect, "
  730:                            "but client channel handler has not reported yet",
  731:                            [?MODULE,?LINE, SenderResult]),
  732: 		    receive
  733: 			{ResultPid, result, Result} ->
  734: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Now got the result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
  735: 			    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  736: 			    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  737: 			    ok;
  738: 			Msg ->
  739: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Got an unexpected msg ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  740: 			    {fail, "Un-expected msg"}
  741: 		    end;
  742: 		Msg ->
  743: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  744: 		    {fail, "Unexpected msg"}
  745: 	    end
  746:     end.
  747: 
  748: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  749: start_shell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  750:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  751:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  752:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  753:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  754:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  755: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  756: 					     {password, "morot"},
  757: 					     {shell, fun(U, H) -> start_our_shell(U, H) end} ]),
  758: 
  759:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  760: 						      {user, "foo"},
  761: 						      {password, "morot"},
  762: 						      {user_interaction, true},
  763: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  764:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Enter command">>), % No pty alloc by erl client
  765:     test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef),
  766:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  767:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  768: 
  769: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  770: new_shell_dumb_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  771:     new_shell_helper(#{term => "dumb",
  772:                        cmds => ["one_atom_please.\n",
  773:                                 "\^R" % attempt to trigger history search
  774:                                ],
  775:                        exp_output =>
  776:                            [<<"Enter command\r\n">>,
  777:                             <<"1> ">>,
  778:                             <<"one_atom_please.\r\n">>,
  779:                             <<"{simple_eval,one_atom_please}\r\n">>,
  780:                             <<"2> ">>],
  781:                        unexp_output =>
  782:                            [<<"\e[;1;4msearch:\e[0m ">>]},
  783:                     Config).
  784: 
  785: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  786: new_shell_xterm_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  787:     new_shell_helper(#{term => "xterm",
  788:                        cmds => ["one_atom_please.\n",
  789:                                 "\^R" % attempt to trigger history search
  790:                                ],
  791:                        exp_output =>
  792:                            [<<"Enter command\r\n">>,
  793:                             <<"1> ">>,
  794:                             <<"one_atom_please.\r\n\e[1022D\e[1B">>,
  795:                             <<"{simple_eval,one_atom_please}\r\n">>,
  796:                             <<"2> ">>,
  797:                             <<"\e[3D\e[J">>,
  798:                             <<"\e[;1;4msearch:\e[0m ">>,
  799:                             <<"\r\n  one_atom_please.">>]},
  800:                     Config).
  801: 
  802: new_shell_helper(#{term := Term, cmds := Cmds,
  803:                    exp_output := ExpectedOutput} = Settings, Config) ->
  804:     UnexpectedOutput = maps:get(unexp_output, Settings, []),
  805:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  806:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  807:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  808:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  809:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  810: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  811: 					     {password, "morot"},
  812:                                              {subsystems, []},
  813:                                              {keepalive, true},
  814:                                              {nodelay, true},
  815:                                              {shell, fun(U, H) ->
  816:                                                              start_our_shell2(U, H)
  817:                                                      end}
  818:                                             ]),
  819:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  820: 						      {user, "foo"},
  821: 						      {password, "morot"},
  822: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  823:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  824:     success =
  825:         ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId,
  826:                                   [{term, Term}, {hight, 24}, {width,1023}],
  827:                                   infinity),
  828:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId),
  829:     [ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, C) || C <- Cmds],
  830:     GetTuple = fun(Bin) -> {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,0,Bin}} end,
  831:     Msgs = [GetTuple(B) || B <- ExpectedOutput],
  832:     expected = ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result(Msgs),
  833:     UnexpectedMsgs = [GetTuple(C) || C <- UnexpectedOutput],
  834:     flush_msgs(UnexpectedMsgs),
  835: 
  836:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  837:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  838: 
  839: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------

  846: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},

  848: 					     {shell, fun(U, H) -> start_our_shell(U, H) end} ]),
  849:

  851: 						      {user, "foo"},

  968: start_shell_exec_fun(Config) ->
  969:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd) ->
  970:                                     spawn(fun() ->
  971:                                                   io:format("echo ~s\n", [Cmd])
  972:                                           end)
  973:                             end,
  974:                             "testing", <<"echo testing\n">>, 0,
  975:                             Config).
  976: 
  977: start_shell_exec_fun2(Config) ->
  978:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd, User) ->
  979:                                     spawn(fun() ->
  980:                                                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
  981:                                           end)
  982:                             end,
  983:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing\n">>, 0,
  984:                             Config).
  985: 
  986: start_shell_exec_fun3(Config) ->
  987:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd, User, _PeerAddr) ->
  988:                                     spawn(fun() ->
  989:                                                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
  990:                                           end)
  991:                             end,
  992:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing\n">>, 0,
  993:                             Config).
  994: 
  995: start_shell_exec_direct_fun(Config) ->
  996:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s~n",[Cmd])} end},
  997:                             "testing", <<"echo testing\n">>, 0,
  998:                             Config).
  999: 
 1000: start_shell_exec_direct_fun2(Config) ->
 1001:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd,User) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s ~s",[User,Cmd])} end},
 1002:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing">>, 0,
 1003:                             Config).
 1004: 
 1005: start_shell_exec_direct_fun3(Config) ->
 1006:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd,User,_PeerAddr) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s ~s",[User,Cmd])} end},
 1007:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing">>, 0,
 1008:                             Config).
 1009: 
 1010: start_shell_exec_direct_fun_more_data(Config) ->
 1011:     N = 60000,
 1012:     ExpectedBin = <<"testing\n">>,
 1013:     ReceiveFun =
 1014:         fun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, _Expect, _ExpectType) ->
 1015:                 receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId,
 1016:                               N * byte_size(ExpectedBin), 0)
 1017:         end,
 1018:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct,
 1019:                              fun(_Cmd) ->
 1020:                                      {ok,
 1021:                                       [io_lib:format("testing~n",[]) ||
 1022:                                           _ <- lists:seq(1, N)]}
 1023:                              end},
 1024:                             "not_relevant", <<"not_used\n">>, 0,
 1025:                             ReceiveFun,
 1026:                             Config).
 1027: 
 1028: start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error(Config) ->
 1029:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(_Cmd) -> {error, {bad}} end},
 1030:                             "testing", <<"**Error** {bad}">>, 1,
 1031:                             Config).
 1032: 
 1033: start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type(Config) ->
 1034:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(_Cmd) -> very_bad end},
 1035:                             "testing", <<"**Error** Bad exec fun in server. Invalid return value: very_bad">>, 1,
 1036:                             Config).
 1037: 
 1038: start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write(Config) ->
 1039:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1040:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1041:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1042:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1043:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1044: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1045: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1046: 					     {exec, {direct,fun read_write_loop/1}}]),
 1047: 
 1048:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1049:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1050:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1051:                                           {user_interaction, true},
 1052:                                           {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1053: 
 1054:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
 1055: 
 1056:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, "> ", infinity),
 1057:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"Tiny read/write test\n">>}}),
 1058: 
 1059:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"1> ">>}}),
 1060:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "hej.\n", 5000),
 1061:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,hej}\n">>}}),
 1062: 
 1063:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"2> ">>}}),
 1064:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "quit.\n", 5000),
 1065:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{1,inputs}">>}}),
 1066:     receive
 1067:         {ssh_cm,C,{exit_status,Ch,0}} -> ok
 1068:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1069:     end,
 1070:     receive
 1071:         {ssh_cm,C,{eof,Ch}} -> ok
 1072:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1073:     end,
 1074:     receive
 1075:         {ssh_cm,C,{closed,Ch}} -> ok
 1076:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1077:     end,
 1078:     receive
 1079:         X -> ct:fail("remaining messages"),
 1080:              ct:log("remaining message: ~p",[X])
 1081:     after 0 -> go_on
 1082:     end,
 1083:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1084: 
 1085: 
 1086: start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced(Config) ->
 1087:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1088:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1089:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1090:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1091:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1092: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1093: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1094: 					     {exec, {direct,fun read_write_loop/1}}]),
 1095: 
 1096:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1097:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1098:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1099:                                           {user_interaction, true},
 1100:                                           {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1101: 
 1102:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
 1103: 
 1104:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, "> ", infinity),
 1105:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"Tiny read/write test\n">>}}),
 1106: 
 1107:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"1> ">>}}),
 1108:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "hej.\n", 5000),
 1109:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,hej}\n">>}}),
 1110: 
 1111:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"2> ">>}}),
 1112:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "'Hi ", 5000),
 1113:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "there", 5000),
 1114:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "'", 5000),
 1115:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, ".\n", 5000),
 1116:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,'Hi there'}\n">>}}),
 1117:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"3> ">>}}),
 1118:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "bad_input.\n", 5000),
 1119:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,1,<<"**Error** {bad_input,3}">>}}),
 1120:     receive
 1121:         {ssh_cm,C,{exit_status,Ch,255}} -> ok
 1122:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1123:     end,
 1124:     receive
 1125:         {ssh_cm,C,{eof,Ch}} -> ok
 1126:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1127:     end,
 1128:     receive
 1129:         {ssh_cm,C,{closed,Ch}} -> ok
 1130:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1131:     end,
 1132:     receive
 1133:         X -> ct:fail("remaining messages"),
 1134:              ct:log("remaining message: ~p",[X])
 1135:     after 0 -> go_on
 1136:     end,
 1137:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1138: 
 1139: 
 1140: 
 1141:     
 1142: %% A tiny read-write loop ended by a 'quit.\n'
 1143: read_write_loop(Prompt) ->
 1144:     io:format("Tiny read/write test~n", []),
 1145:     read_write_loop1(Prompt, 1).
 1146: 
 1147: read_write_loop1(Prompt, N) ->
 1148:     case io:read(lists:concat([N,Prompt])) of
 1149:         {ok, quit} ->
 1150:             {ok, {N-1, inputs}};
 1151:         {ok, bad_input} ->
 1152:             {error, {bad_input,N}};
 1153:         {ok,Inp} ->
 1154:             io:format("~p~n",[simple_eval(Inp)]),
 1155:             read_write_loop1(Prompt, N+1)
 1156:     end.
 1157:     
 1158: simple_eval(Inp) -> {simple_eval,Inp}.
 1159: 
 1160: 
 1161: do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, Config) ->
 1162:     DefaultReceiveFun =
 1163:         fun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Expect, ExpectType) ->
 1164:                 receive
 1165:                     {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, ExpectType, Expect}} ->
 1166:                         ok
 1167:                 after 5000 ->
 1168:                         receive
 1169:                             Other ->
 1170:                                 ct:log("Received other:~n~p~nExpected: ~p~n",
 1171:                                        [Other,
 1172:                                         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,
 1173:                                          {data, ChannelId, ExpectType, Expect}}]),
 1174:                                          %% {data, '_ChannelId', ExpectType, Expect}}]),
 1175:                                 ct:fail("Unexpected response")
 1176:                         after 0 ->
 1177:                                 ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1178:                         end
 1179:                 end
 1180:         end,
 1181:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, DefaultReceiveFun, Config).
 1182: 
 1183: do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, ReceiveFun, Config) ->
 1184:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1185:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1186:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1187:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1188:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1189: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1190: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1191: 					     {exec, Fun}]),
 1192: 
 1193:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1194: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1195: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1196: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1197: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1198: 
 1199:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1200:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Command, infinity),
 1201:     ReceiveFun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Expect, ExpectType),
 1202:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1203:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1204: 
 1205: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1206: start_shell_sock_exec_fun(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1207:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1208:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1209:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1210:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1211:     {Pid, HostD, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1212:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
 1213:                                               {password, "morot"},
 1214:                                               {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1215:     Host = ssh_test_lib:ntoa(ssh_test_lib:mangle_connect_address(HostD)),
 1216: 
 1217:     {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, [{active,false}]),
 1218:     {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1219:                                             {save_accepted_host, false},
 1220: 					    {user, "foo"},
 1221: 					    {password, "morot"},
 1222: 					    {user_interaction, true},
 1223: 					    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1224: 
 1225:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1226: 
 1227:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1228: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1229: 
 1230:     receive
 1231: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1232: 	    ok
 1233:     after 5000 ->
 1234: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1235:     end,
 1236: 
 1237:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1238:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1239: 
 1240: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1241: start_shell_sock_daemon_exec(Config) ->
 1242:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1243:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1244:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1245:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1246: 
 1247:     %% Listening tcp socket at the client side
 1248:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 1249:     {ok,{_IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),	% _IP is likely to be {0,0,0,0}. Win don't like...
 1250: 
 1251:     %% A server tcp-contects to the listening socket and starts an ssh daemon
 1252:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1253: 		       {ok,Ss} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Port, [{active,false}]),
 1254: 		       {ok, _Pid} = ssh:daemon(Ss, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1255: 						    {user_dir, UserDir},
 1256: 						    {password, "morot"},
 1257: 						    {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}])
 1258: 	       end),
 1259: 
 1260:     %% The client accepts the tcp connection from the server and ssh-connects to it
 1261:     {ok,Sc} = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1262:     {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sc, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1263:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1264: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1265: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1266: 					  {user_interaction, true},
 1267: 					  {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1268: 
 1269:     %% And runs some commands
 1270:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1271: 
 1272:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1273: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1274: 
 1275:     receive
 1276: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1277: 	    ok
 1278:     after 5000 ->
 1279: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1280:     end,
 1281: 
 1282:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
 1283: 
 1284: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1285: start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi(Config) ->
 1286:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1287:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1288:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1289:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1290: 
 1291:     NumConcurent = 5,
 1292: 
 1293:     %% Listening tcp socket at the client side
 1294:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 1295:     {ok,{_IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),	% _IP is likely to be {0,0,0,0}. Win don't like...
 1296: 
 1297:     DaemonOpts = [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1298:                   {user_dir, UserDir},
 1299:                   {password, "morot"},
 1300:                   {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}],
 1301: 
 1302:     %% Servers tcp-contects to the listening socket and starts an ssh daemon
 1303:     Pids =
 1304:         [spawn_link(fun() ->
 1305:                             {ok,Ss} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Port, [{active,false}]),
 1306:                             {ok, _Pid} = ssh:daemon(Ss, DaemonOpts)
 1307:                     end)
 1308:          || _ <- lists:seq(1,NumConcurent)],
 1309:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p daemons spawned!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(Pids)]),
 1310: 
 1311:     %% The client accepts the tcp connections from the servers and ssh-connects to it
 1312:     ConnectionRefs =
 1313:         [begin
 1314:              {ok,Sc} = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1315:              {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sc, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1316:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
 1317:                                                    {user, "foo"},
 1318:                                                    {password, "morot"},
 1319:                                                    {user_interaction, true},
 1320:                                                    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1321:              ConnectionRef
 1322:          end || _Pid <- Pids],
 1323:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p connections accepted!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(ConnectionRefs)]),
 1324: 
 1325:     %% And runs some exec commands
 1326:     Parent = self(),
 1327:     ClientPids =
 1328:         lists:map(
 1329:           fun(ConnectionRef) ->
 1330:                   spawn_link(
 1331:                     fun() ->
 1332:                             {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1333:                             success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, "testing", infinity),
 1334:                             ct:log("~p:~p: exec on connection ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,ConnectionRef]),
 1335:                             receive
 1336:                                 {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1337:                                     Parent ! {answer_received,self()},
 1338:                                     ct:log("~p:~p: received result on connection ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,ConnectionRef])
 1339:                             after 5000 ->
 1340:                                     ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1341:                             end
 1342:                     end)
 1343:           end, ConnectionRefs),
 1344:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p clients spawned!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(ClientPids)]),
 1345: 
 1346:     lists:foreach(fun(P) ->
 1347:                           receive
 1348:                               {answer_received,P} -> ok
 1349:                           end
 1350:                   end, ClientPids),
 1351:     ct:log("~p:~p: All answers received!", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
 1352: 
 1353:     lists:foreach(fun ssh:close/1, ConnectionRefs).
 1354: 
 1355: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1356: gracefull_invalid_version(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1357:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1358:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1359:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1360:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1361:     
 1362:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1363:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1364:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1365: 
 1366:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1367:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S,  ["SSH-8.-1","\r\n"]),
 1368:     receive
 1369: 	Verstring ->
 1370: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),
 1371: 	    receive
 1372: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 1373: 		    ok
 1374: 	    end
 1375:     after 
 1376: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1377:     end.
 1378: 
 1379: gracefull_invalid_start(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1380:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1381:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1382:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1383:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1384:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1385:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1386:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1387: 
 1388:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1389:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S,  ["foobar","\r\n"]),
 1390:     receive
 1391: 	Verstring ->
 1392: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),
 1393: 	    receive
 1394: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 1395: 		    ok
 1396: 	    end
 1397:     after 
 1398: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1399:     end.
 1400: 
 1401: gracefull_invalid_long_start(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1402:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1403:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1404:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1405:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1406:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1407:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1408:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1409: 
 1410:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1411:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S, [lists:duplicate(257, $a), "\r\n"]),
 1412:     receive
 1413: 	Verstring ->
 1414: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),
 1415: 	    receive
 1416: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 1417: 		    ok
 1418: 	    end

 1426:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1427:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1428:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1429:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1430:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1431:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1432: 
 1433:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1434:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S, [lists:duplicate(257, $a), "\r\n"]),
 1435:     receive
 1436: 	Verstring ->
 1437: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),
 1438: 	    receive
 1439: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 1440: 		    ok
 1441: 	    end
