 1445: 
 1446: kex_error(Config) ->
 1447:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1448:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1449:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1450:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1451:     [Kex1,Kex2|_] = proplists:get_value(kex, ssh:default_algorithms()),
 1452:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1453:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
 1454:                                               {password, "morot"},
 1455:                                               {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[Kex1]}]}
 1456:                                              ]),
 1457:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1458:     ok = ssh_log_h:add_fun(kex_error,
 1459:                            fun(#{msg:={report,#{format:=Fmt,args:=As,label:={error_logger,_}}}}, Pid) ->
 1460:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1461:                                    Pid ! {Ref, lists:flatten(io_lib:format(Fmt,As))};
 1462:                               (_,Pid) ->
 1463:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1464:                                    ok % Other msg
 1465:                            end,
 1466:                            self()),
 1467:     try
 1468:         ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1469:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1470:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1471:                                           {user_interaction, false},
 1472:                                           {user_dir, UserDir},
 1473:                                           {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[Kex2]}]}
 1474:                                          ])
 1475:     of
 1476:         _ ->
 1477:             ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1478:             ct:fail("expected failure", [])
 1479:     catch
 1480:         error:{badmatch,{error,"Key exchange failed"}} ->
 1481:             %% ok
 1482:             receive
 1483:                 {Ref, ErrMsgTxt} ->
 1484:                     ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1485:                     ct:log("ErrMsgTxt = ~n~s", [ErrMsgTxt]),
 1486:                     Lines = lists:map(fun string:trim/1, string:tokens(ErrMsgTxt, "\n")),
 1487:                     OK = (lists:all(fun(S) -> lists:member(S,Lines) end,
 1488:                                     ["Disconnects with code = 3 [RFC4253 11.1]: Key exchange failed",
 1489:                                      "Details:",
 1490:                                      "No common key exchange algorithm,",
 1491:                                      "we have:",
 1492:                                      "peer have:"]) andalso
 1493:                           string:find(ErrMsgTxt, atom_to_list(Kex1)) =/= nomatch andalso
 1494:                           string:find(ErrMsgTxt, atom_to_list(Kex2)) =/= nomatch),
 1495:                     case OK of
 1496:                         true ->
 1497:                             ok;
 1498:                         false ->
 1499:                             ct:fail("unexpected error text msg", [])
 1500:                     end
 1501:             after 20000 ->
 1502:                     ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1503:                     ct:fail("timeout", [])
 1504:             end;
 1505: 
 1506:         error:{badmatch,{error,_}} ->
 1507:             ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1508:             ct:fail("unexpected error msg", [])
 1509:     end.
 1510: 
 1511: stop_listener(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1512:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1513:     %% to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1514:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey),
 1515:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1516:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1517: 
 1518:     {Pid0, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1519: 					      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1520: 					      {password, "morot"},
 1521: 					      {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1522: 
 1523:     ConnectionRef0 = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port,
 1524:                                           [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1525:                                            {user, "foo"},
 1526:                                            {password, "morot"},
 1527:                                            {user_interaction, false},
 1528:                                            {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1529:     {ok, ChannelId0} =
 1530:         ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef0, infinity),
 1531: 
 1532:     ssh:stop_listener(Host, Port),
 1533: 
 1534:     {error, _} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1535:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1536:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1537: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1538: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1539: 					  {user_interaction, true},
 1540: 					  {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1541:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef0, ChannelId0,
 1542: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1543:     receive
 1544: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef0,
 1545:          {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1546: 	    ok
 1547:     after 5000 ->
 1548: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1549:     end,
 1550: 
 1551:     case ssh_test_lib:daemon(Port, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1552:                                     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1553:                                     {password, "potatis"},
 1554:                                     {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]) of
 1555: 	{Pid1, Host, Port} ->
 1556: 	    ConnectionRef1 =
 1557:                 ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1558:                                                   {user, "foo"},
 1559:                                                   {password, "potatis"},
 1560:                                                   {user_interaction, true},
 1561:                                                   {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1562: 	    {error, _} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1563:                                                   {save_accepted_host, false},
 1564:                                                   {user, "foo"},
 1565:                                                   {password, "morot"},
 1566:                                                   {user_interaction, true},
 1567:                                                   {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1568: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef0),
 1569: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef1),
 1570: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid0),
 1571: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid1);
 1572: 	Error ->
 1573: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef0),
 1574: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid0),
 1575: 	    ct:fail({unexpected, Error})
 1576:     end.
 1577: 
 1578: no_sensitive_leak(Config) ->
 1579:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1580:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1581:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1582:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1583: 
 1584:     %% Save old, and set new log level:
 1585:     #{level := Level} = logger:get_primary_config(),
 1586:     logger:set_primary_config(level, info),
 1587:     %% Define a collect fun:
 1588:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1589:     Collect = 
 1590:         fun G(N,Nf,Nt) ->
 1591:                 receive
 1592:                     {Ref, false, _} ->
 1593:                         G(N+1, Nf+1, Nt);
 1594:                     {Ref, true, R} ->
 1595:                         ct:log("Report leaked:~n~p", [R]),
 1596:                         G(N+1, Nf, Nt+1)
 1597:                 after 100 ->
 1598:                         {N, Nf, Nt}
 1599:                 end
 1600:         end,
 1601:  
 1602:     %% Install the test handler:
 1603:     Hname = no_sensitive_leak,
 1604:     ok = ssh_log_h:add_fun(Hname,
 1605:                            fun(#{msg := {report,#{report := Rep}}}, Pid) ->
 1606:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid, status) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1607:                                    Pid ! {Ref,ssh_log_h:sensitive_in_opt(Rep),Rep};
 1608:                               (_,Pid) ->
 1609:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid, status) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1610:                                    ok
 1611:                            end,
 1612:                            self()),
 1613: 
 1614:     {_Pid0, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1615: 					      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1616: 					      {password, "morot"},
 1617: 					      {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1618: 
 1619:     _ConnectionRef0 = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1620: 						       {user, "foo"},
 1621: 						       {password, "morot"},
 1622: 						       {user_interaction, true},
 1623: 						       {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1624:     %% Kill acceptor to make it restart:
 1625:     [true|_] =
 1626:         [exit(Pacc,kill) || {{ssh_system_sup,_},P1,supervisor,_} <- supervisor:which_children(sshd_sup),
 1627:                             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,_},P2,supervisor,_} <- supervisor:which_children(P1),
 1628:                             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,_},Pacc,worker,_} <- supervisor:which_children(P2)],
 1629:     
 1630:     %% Remove the test handler and reset the logger level:
 1631:     timer:sleep(500),
 1632:     logger:remove_handler(Hname),
 1633:     logger:set_primary_config(Level),
 1634: 
 1635:     case Collect(0, 0, 0) of
 1636:         {0, 0,   0} -> ct:fail("Logging failed, line = ~p", [?LINE]);
 1637:         {_, _,   0} -> ok;
 1638:         {_, _, Nt0} -> ct:fail("Leak in ~p cases!", [Nt0])
 1639:     end.
 1640:     
 1641: start_subsystem_on_closed_channel(Config) ->
 1642:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1643:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1644:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1645:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1646:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1647: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1648: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1649: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n", {ssh_echo_server, [4000000]}}]}]),
 1650: 
 1651:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1652: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1653: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1654: 						      {user_interaction, false},
 1655: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1656: 
 1657: 
 1658:     {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1659:     ok = ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1),
 1660:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, []),
 1661:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", 5000),
 1662:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "testing1.\n", 5000),
 1663:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1664: 
 1665:     %% Test that there could be a gap between close and an operation (Bugfix OTP-14939):
 1666:     {ok, ChannelId2} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1667:     ok = ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2),
 1668:     timer:sleep(2000),
 1669:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, []),
 1670:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "echo_n", 5000),
 1671:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "testing1.\n", 5000),
 1672:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1673: 
 1674:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1675:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1676: 
 1677: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1678: max_channels_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1679:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1680:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1681:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1682:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1683:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1684: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1685: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1686: 					     {max_channels, 3},
 1687: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n", {ssh_echo_server, [4000000]}}]}
 1688: 					    ]),
 1689: 
 1690:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1691: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1692: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1693: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1694: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1695: 
 1696:     %% Allocate a number of ChannelId:s to play with. (This operation is not
 1697:     %% counted by the max_channel option).
 1698:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1699:     {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1700:     {ok, ChannelId2} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1701:     {ok, ChannelId3} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1702:     {ok, ChannelId4} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1703:     {ok, ChannelId5} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1704:     {ok, ChannelId6} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1705:     {ok, _ChannelId7} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1706: 
 1707:     %% Now start to open the channels (this is counted my max_channels) to check that
 1708:     %% it gives a failure at right place
 1709: 
 1710:     %%%---- Channel 1(3): shell
 1711:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId0),
 1712:     receive
 1713: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"Eshell",_/binary>>}} ->
 1714: 	    ok
 1715:     after 5000 ->
 1716: 	    ct:fail("CLI Timeout")
 1717:     end,
 1718: 
 1719:     %%%---- Channel 2(3): subsystem "echo_n"
 1720:     success = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", infinity),
 1721: 
 1722:     %%%---- Channel 3(3): exec. This closes itself.
 1723:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "testing1.\n", infinity),
 1724:     receive
 1725: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId2, 0, <<"testing1",_/binary>>}} ->
 1726: 	    ok
 1727:     after 5000 ->
 1728: 	    ct:fail("Exec #1 Timeout")
 1729:     end,
 1730: 
 1731:     %%%---- Channel 3(3): subsystem "echo_n" (Note that ChannelId2 should be closed now)
 1732:     ?wait_match(success, ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId3, "echo_n", infinity)),
 1733: 
 1734:     %%%---- Channel 4(3) !: exec  This should fail
 1735:     failure = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId4, "testing2.\n", infinity),
 1736: 
 1737:     %%%---- close the shell (Frees one channel)
 1738:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1739:     
 1740:     %%%---- wait for the subsystem to terminate
 1741:     receive
 1742: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef,{closed,ChannelId0}} -> ok
 1743:     after 5000 ->
 1744: 	    ct:log("Timeout waiting for '{ssh_cm,~p,{closed,~p}}'~n"
 1745: 		   "Message queue:~n~p",
 1746: 		   [ConnectionRef,ChannelId0,erlang:process_info(self(),messages)]),
 1747: 	    ct:fail("exit Timeout",[])
 1748:     end,
 1749: 
 1750:     %%---- Try that we can open one channel instead of the closed one
 1751:     ?wait_match(success, ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId5, "echo_n", infinity)),
 1752: 
 1753:     %%---- But not a fourth one...
 1754:     failure = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId6, "echo_n", infinity),
 1755: 
 1756:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1757:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1758: 
 1759: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1760: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
 1761: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1762: do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef) ->
 1763:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, 1).
 1764: 
 1765: do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, N) ->
 1766:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1767:     Cmd = "yes testing | head -n " ++ integer_to_list(N),
 1768:     ct:log("Cmd to be invoked over SSH shell: ~p", [Cmd]),
 1769:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Cmd, infinity),
 1770:     ExpectedBin = <<"testing\n">>,
 1771:     case N of
 1772:         1 ->
 1773:             %% receive response to input
 1774:             receive
 1775:                 {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, ExpectedBin}} ->
 1776:                     ok
 1777:             after
 1778:                 10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1779:             end;
 1780:         _ ->
 1781:             receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, N * byte_size(ExpectedBin), 0)
 1782:     end,
 1783: 
 1784:     %% receive close messages
 1785:     receive
 1786: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
 1787: 	    ok
 1788:     after
 1789: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1790:     end,
 1791:     receive
 1792: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
 1793: 	    ok
 1794:     after
 1795: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1796:     end,
 1797:     receive
 1798: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
 1799: 	    ok
 1800:     after
 1801: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1802:     end.
 1803: 
 1804: 
 1805: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1806: flush_msgs() ->
 1807:     flush_msgs([]).
 1808: 
 1809: flush_msgs(Unexpected) ->
 1810:     receive
 1811:         M ->
 1812:             case lists:member(M, Unexpected) of
 1813:                 true ->
 1814:                     ct:fail("Unexpected message found:  ~p", [M]);
 1815:                 _ ->
 1816:                     flush_msgs()
 1817:             end
 1818:     after
 1819:         500 -> ok
 1820:     end.
 1821: 
 1822: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1823: test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1824:     test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Prohibited.">>, <<"Eshell V">>).
 1825: 
 1826: test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, NotExpect) ->
 1827:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1828:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef, ChannelId),
 1829:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 1830:     NotExpSz = size(NotExpect),
 1831:     receive
 1832:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 1, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 1833:             flush_msgs();
 1834: 
 1835:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<NotExpect:NotExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 1836:             ct:fail("Could start disabled shell!");
 1837: 
 1838:         R ->
 1839:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1840:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, '0|1', Expect}} ]),
 1841:             ct:fail("Strange shell response")
 1842: 
 1843:     after 5000 ->
 1844:             ct:fail("Shell Timeout")
 1845:     end.
 1846: 
 1847: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1848: test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1849:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1850:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "1+2.", infinity),
 1851:     receive
 1852:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,1,<<"Prohibited.">>}} ->
 1853:             flush_msgs();
 1854:         R ->
 1855:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1856:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,1,<<"Prohibited.">>}} ]),
 1857:             ct:fail("Could exec erlang term although non-erlang shell")
 1858:     after 5000 ->
 1859:             ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1860:     end.
 1861: 
 1862: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1863: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1864:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Eshell V">>).
 1865: 
 1866: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect) ->
 1867:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, []).
 1868: 
 1869: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, PtyOpts) ->
 1870:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1871:     case PtyOpts of
 1872:         [] ->
 1873:             no_alloc;
 1874:         _ ->
 1875:             success = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, PtyOpts)
 1876:     end,
 1877:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId),
 1878: 
 1879:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 1880:     receive
 1881: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 1882: 	    flush_msgs();
 1883: 
 1884:         R ->
 1885:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1886:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Expect}} ]),
 1887:             ct:fail("Strange shell response")
 1888: 
 1889:     after 5000 ->
 1890: 	    ct:fail("CLI Timeout")
 1891:     end.
 1892: 
 1893: 
 1894: test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1895:     test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, "1+2.", <<"3">>).
 1896: 
 1897: test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Exec, Expect) ->
 1898:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1899:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Exec, infinity),
 1900:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 1901:     receive
 1902:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} = R ->
 1903:             ct:log("~p:~p Got expected ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,R]);
 1904:         Other ->
 1905:             %% FIXME - should this testcase fail when unexpected data is received?
 1906:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1907:                    [?MODULE,?LINE, Other, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Expect}} ])
 1908:     after 5000 ->
 1909:             {fail,"Exec Timeout"}
 1910:     end.
 1911: 
 1912: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1913: big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId) ->
 1914:     big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, []).
 1915: 
 1916: big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Acc) ->
 1917:     receive
 1918: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Data}} ->
 1919: 	    big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, [Data | Acc]);
 1920: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId}} ->
 1921: 	    {ok, iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))}
 1922:     after ?EXEC_TIMEOUT ->
 1923: 	    timeout
 1924:     end.
 1925: 
 1926: collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize) ->
 1927:     ct:log("~p:~p Listener ~p running! ConnectionRef=~p, ChannelId=~p",
 1928:            [?MODULE,?LINE,self(),ConnectionRef,ChannelId]),
 1929:     collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, [], 0).
 1930: 
 1931: collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum) ->
 1932:     TO = 5000,
 1933:     receive
 1934: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Data}} when is_binary(Data) ->
 1935: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p bytes. total ~p bytes,  want ~p more",
 1936: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,size(Data),Sum+size(Data),EchoSize-Sum]),
 1937: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, [Data | Acc], Sum+size(Data));
 1938: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, Msg={eof, ChannelId}} ->
 1939: 	    collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize);
 1940: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, Msg={closed,ChannelId}} ->
 1941: 	    collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize);
 1942: 	Msg ->
 1943: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: ***** unexpected message *****~n~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
 1944: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum)
 1945:     after TO ->
 1946: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: ----- Nothing received for ~p seconds -----~n",[?MODULE,?LINE,TO]),
 1947: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum)
 1948:     end.
 1949: 
 1950: collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize) ->
 1951:     try
 1952: 	iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))
 1953:     of
 1954: 	Bin ->
 1955: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p.~nGot in total ~p bytes,  want ~p more",
 1956: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,Msg,size(Bin),EchoSize,size(Bin)]),
 1957: 	    Bin
 1958:     catch
 1959: 	C:E ->
 1960: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p.~nAcc is strange...~nException=~p:~p~nAcc=~p",
 1961: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,Msg,C,E,Acc]),
 1962: 	    {error,{C,E}}
 1963:     end.
 1964: 
 1965: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
 1966: %% This is taken from the ssh example code.
 1967: start_our_shell(_User, _Peer) ->
 1968:     spawn(fun() ->
 1969: 		  io:format("Enter command\n")
 1970: 		  %% Don't actually loop, just exit
 1971:           end).
 1972: 
 1973: start_our_shell2(_User, _Peer) ->
 1974:     spawn(fun() ->
 1975:                   io:format("Enter command\n"),
 1976:                   read_write_loop1("> ", 1)
 1977:           end).
 1978: 
 1979: ssh_exec_echo(Cmd) ->
 1980:     spawn(fun() ->
 1981:                   io:format("echo ~s\n", [Cmd])
 1982:           end).
 1983: 
 1984: ssh_exec_echo(Cmd, User) ->
 1985:     spawn(fun() ->
 1986:                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
 1987:           end).
 1988: %% FIXME - upon refactoring this test suite, check if function below is reduntant to collect_data
 1989: receive_bytes(_, _, 0, _) ->
 1990:     ct:log("ALL DATA RECEIVED Budget = 0"),
 1991:     ct:log("================================ ExpectBudget = 0 (reception completed)"),
 1992:     ok;
 1993: receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Budget, AccSize) when Budget > 0 ->
 1994:     receive
 1995:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, D}} ->
 1996:             Fmt = "================================ ExpectBudget = "
 1997:                 "~p bytes Received/Total = ~p/~p bytes",
 1998:             Args = [Budget, byte_size(D), AccSize + byte_size(D)],
 1999:             ct:log(Fmt, Args),
 2000:             receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 2001:                           Budget - byte_size(D), AccSize + byte_size(D))
 2002:     after
 2003:         10000 ->
 2004:             ct:log("process_info(self(), messages) = ~p",
 2005:                    [process_info(self(), messages)]),
 2006:             ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 2007:     end.
